page.title: 13POPULATION OF LINTON
page.content: During the first half of this century the population of Linton was almost static.But since World War 2 the population has increased rapidly,the biggest increase being within the last twenty years.Eg.population in 1961 1,813.In 1971 it was 2,627.In 1981 it was 4,110.This large expansion of the village would seem to be linked with the fact that Linton is no longer just serving the local area but is a dormitory village serving London, Cambridge,Saffron Walden etc.This in turn is connected with the improvement in transport.Eg.the building of the M11 to London. This year(1985)there have been 18 deaths,6 weddings and 11 babies born. All of the 25 people interviewed lived in Linton,24% work in Linton. By DAVID NIGHTINGALE,ALEXANDER SMITH, EMMA HICKS,JOANNA FOXALL,NICK SMITH.
